means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 利姆 Lumb的变体

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"枝"之意。
means: branch ： 普通用词，泛指树木比bough小一些的大枝或小枝，也可用于引申意义。
bough ： 指主枝或粗大强壮的枝。
shoot ： 指植物或灌木刚长出的新枝、嫩枝或嫩芽。

word_mean: 肢，肢体：身体用于运动或攫取的附肢。在人类，为上肢或下肢及其所有组成部分，又称membrum 〔NA〕，曾称extremitas。在胚胎期，肢体分为四个主要部分，即肢带骨(zonoskeleton)包括肩胛骨和锁骨(作为一个单位)和髋骨，柱骨(stylopodium)包括肱骨和股骨，肢干(zygopodium)包括桡骨、尺骨、胫骨和腓骨和端骨(autopodium)包括手和足
似上肢或下肢的某个结构或部分

sentence.Network_en: Try to rest the injured limb as much as possible.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽量不要活动受伤的手臂。

sentence.Network_en: She sat on a limb of the tree and looked down.
sentence.Network_cn: 她坐在一根大树枝上往下看.

sentence.Network_en: His refusal to agree left him out on a limb.
sentence.Network_cn: 他拒不表示同意,致使自己处于孤立地位.

lj.lj_ly: a reckless disregard for life and limb.
lj.lj_ls: 毫不顾及他人的生死安危。

lj.lj_ly: Aberdeen is rather out on a limb.
lj.lj_ls: 阿伯丁市僻处一隅，地位孤立。

jx.jx_en_mean: in or into a position where one is not joined or supported by anyone else

lj.lj_ly: going out on a limb to support unglamorous causes.
lj.lj_ls: 单枪匹马支持毫无吸引力的事业。

jx.jx_en_mean: In a difficult, awkward, or vulnerable position.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 处于困境：处于危险、尴尬或易受攻击的境地

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English lim (also in the sense 'organ or part of the body'), of Germanic origin
late Middle English: from French limbe or Latin limbus 'hem, border'

entry.def: Your limbs are your arms and legs.

example.ex: She would be able to stretch out her cramped limbs and rest for a few hours.
example.tran: 她将能伸展一下蜷缩的四肢，休息几个小时。

entry.def: The limbs of a tree are its branches.

example.ex: This entire rickety structure was hanging from the limb of an enormous leafy tree.
example.tran: 这整个快要散架的搭建物吊挂在一棵枝繁叶茂的大树的枝杈上。

entry.tran: 冒着遭受失败（或指责）的风险；处于孤立无援的境地
entry.def: If someone goes out on a limb, they do something they strongly believe in even though it is risky or extreme, and is likely to fail or be criticized by other people.

example.ex: They can see themselves going out on a limb, voting for a very controversial energy bill.
example.tran: 他们可以预见到要是给极具争议性的能源法案投赞成票，可能会陷入孤立。

entry.def: If someone threatens to tear you limb from limb, they mean that they are extremely angry with you, and may use violence against you.

example.ex: The police were lucky they found him before I did. I would have torn him limb from limb.
example.tran: 警察很幸运，比我先找到了他。不然我真会把他大卸八块的。

means.word_mean: 1. one of the jointed appendages of an animal used for locomotion or grasping: arm; leg; wing; flipper
2. any of the main branches arising from the trunk or a bough of a tree
3. (astronomy) the circumferential edge of the apparent disc of the sun or the moon or a planet
4. either of the two halves of a bow from handle to tip;
5. the graduated arc that is attached to an instrument for measuring angles;
6. any projection that is thought to resemble an arm;
